subject: Test EJB's in weblogic
msgSnippet: Hello, I have seen many discussions on testing J2EE related code. I have looked at HttpUnit which is great for testing the front end. I have looked at Cactus
messageBody:
Hello,

I have seen many discussions on testing J2EE related
code. I have looked at HttpUnit which is great for
testing the front end. I have looked at Cactus for
testing servlets. However I don't feel I need to test
the servlets directly as they are dynamically compiled
via the serving of JSP's. I have been using HttpUnit
to test the JSP's. What I do want to do is test the
EJB's in the Weblogic EJB container along with any
classes that make calls to EJB's. Obviously to get an
EJB instance I need to be able to access or be inside
an EJB container.

One approach I was thinking is to write some unit
tests that would be available inside a weblogic
server. I could then either run the tests on startup
of the server or write an admin type jsp to run the
tests. The results could then be output the weblogic
console or a jsp.

Has anyone had to do something similar before. If so
any helpfull comments would be most appreciated. In
addition any code examples would also be a plus.

Regards

David
